newsitem.title: FRANCE: TPS agrees pre-purchase for 1st two French films.
newsitem.headline: TPS agrees pre-purchase for 1st two French films.

text.p: French digital satellite television service Television par Satellite (TPS) has just clinched its first film pre-purchase deals, TPS managing director Cyrille du Peloux said in an interview.
He told Friday's edition of daily newspaper Le Figaro that TPS had bought exclusive rights for first and second run and non-exclusive rights for pay-per-view for two French films.

TPS spent 13.5 million francs ($2.4 million) on pre-purchasing "Droit dans le Mur", a comedy by French actor Pierre Richard, and 16.5 million francs for "Voleur de Vie" with French actress Emmanuelle Beart, du Peloux said.
Other announcements are due to follow in the next few weeks, a TPS spokeswoman said.
